meanings.definition: The former currency of Austria, Germany, and other European countries.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people used schillings to buy things in Europe.
meanings.sent2: I found an old coin worth five schillings in my grandfather's collection.
meanings.sent3: Why did the ghost pay for its haunted house with schillings?
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as valuable as a bag of schillings.
meanings.sent5: The sound of schillings clinking together brought back memories of the past.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency equal to 1/20 of a pound in the UK.
meanings.sent1: I exchanged my pounds for schillings before traveling to the UK.
meanings.sent2: The price of the book was two schillings and sixpence.
meanings.sent3: Why did the squirrel bury its acorns under a pile of schillings?
meanings.sent4: His words were as sharp as a handful of schillings.
meanings.sent5: The shiny silver schillings sparkled in the sunlight.
